newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Petrobras shrs sold for 240.99 mln.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Petrobras shrs sold for 240.99 mln.

text.p: The investment arm of Brazil's National Development Bank (BNDESpar) has auctioned one billion preference shares in state oil monopoly Petrobras for 240.99 million reais ($225.22 million), a stock exchange spokeswoman said.
The final auction price of 240.99 reais ($225.22) per lot of 1,000 shares was 0.26 percent above the minimum price of 240.37 reais ($224.64) per 1,000 shares, the spokeswoman said.

The auction on the Rio de Janeiro stock exchange, guaranteed by 32 financial institutions, was the first of two offers of Petrobras preference shares held in the BNDESpar portfolio and will be followed by a global offer worth $400 million.

The global offer, tentatively scheduled for July and coordinated by Credit Suisse First Boston, will place $300 million worth of shares in international markets and $100 million worth of shares will be offered in Brazil.
Brazil is expected to earn $10 billion this year from share offers in international markets, up from $500 million in the past two years.
((--Simona de Logu, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 507 4151))
